rev.comment: /* Easter eggs and April Fool's Day jokes */ still *does* offer these "languages"
rev.diff:
Line 124: Line 124:
Some thought the announcement of [[Gmail]] in 2004 around April Fool's Day (as well as the doubling of Gmail's storage space to two gigabytes in 2005) was a joke, although both of these turned out to be genuine announcements. In 2005, a comedic graph depicting Google's goal of "infinity plus one" GB of storage was featured on the [[Gmail]] homepage.
Some thought the announcement of [[Gmail]] in 2004 around April Fool's Day (as well as the doubling of Gmail's storage space to two gigabytes in 2005) was a joke, although both of these turned out to be genuine announcements. In 2005, a comedic graph depicting Google's goal of "infinity plus one" GB of storage was featured on the [[Gmail]] homepage.
â
Google's services contain a number of [[Easter egg (virtual)|Easter eggs]]; for instance, the Language Tools page once offered the search interface in the [[Swedish Chef]]'s "Bork bork bork," [[Pig Latin]], âHackerâ (Actually [[leetspeak]]), [[Elmer Fudd]], and [[Klingon language|Klingon]].<ref>"[http://www.google.com/language_tools?hl=en Language Tools]." ''[[Google]].'' Retrieved on [[January 24]] [[2007]].</ref> When asked how to get from a location in the U.S. to a location in Europe, Google Maps will provide directions that include an instruction to "Swim across the Atlantic Ocean." <ref name="atlantic">"[http://maps.google.com/maps?f=d&hl=en&saddr=North+America&daddr=Germany Google Maps]." ''Google.'' Retrieved on [[May 2]] [[2007]].</ref> In addition, the search engine calculator provides [[The Answer to Life, the Universe, and Everything]] from [[Douglas Adams]]' ''[[The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy]]''.<ref>"[http://www.google.com/search?q=answer+to+life+the+universe+and+everything Google Search Results for 'answer to life the universe and everything']." ''[[Google]].'' Retrieved on [[January 24]] [[2007]].</ref>
+
Google's services contain a number of [[Easter egg (virtual)|Easter eggs]]; for instance, the Language Tools page offers the search interface in the [[Swedish Chef]]'s "Bork bork bork," [[Pig Latin]], âHackerâ (Actually [[leetspeak]]), [[Elmer Fudd]], and [[Klingon language|Klingon]].<ref>"[http://www.google.com/language_tools?hl=en Language Tools]." ''[[Google]].'' Retrieved on [[January 24]] [[2007]].</ref> When asked how to get from a location in the U.S. to a location in Europe, Google Maps will provide directions that include an instruction to "Swim across the Atlantic Ocean." <ref name="atlantic">"[http://maps.google.com/maps?f=d&hl=en&saddr=North+America&daddr=Germany Google Maps]." ''Google.'' Retrieved on [[May 2]] [[2007]].</ref> In addition, the search engine calculator provides [[The Answer to Life, the Universe, and Everything]] from [[Douglas Adams]]' ''[[The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy]]''.<ref>"[http://www.google.com/search?q=answer+to+life+the+universe+and+everything Google Search Results for 'answer to life the universe and everything']." ''[[Google]].'' Retrieved on [[January 24]] [[2007]].</ref>
Google also likes to change their logos on special days, such as on christmas the logo is a frosted snowy scene, in the 2006 winter olympics in [[Turin]], the logo was a skiing scene and it stayed like this throughout the duration of the olympics.<ref name="google_holiday">"[http://www.google.com/intl/en/holidaylogos.html Holiday logos]." ''Google''. Retrieved on [[21 May]] [[2007]].</ref>
